author: Scripps News Staff
title: DNC protest organizer calls on Democratic leadership to end 'genocide' in Gaza
text: Chicago police are bracing for yet another night of protests as demonstrators continue to march just blocks from where the final night of the Democratic National Convention is being held. Thousands of pro-Palestinians have rallied in the area throughout the week, as they voice displeasure with Democratic leaders who support U.S. aid to Israel. While the demonstrations have remained mostly peaceful, dozens of people were arrested Tuesday when protesters clashed with police near the Israeli consulate. RELATED STORY | [Protests outside DNC begin calmly after violent clashes the previous night led to dozens of arrests](https://www.scrippsnews.com/politics/protests-outside-dnc-begin-calmly-after-violent-clashes-the-previous-night-led-to-dozens-of-arrests) Scripps News has been on the ground monitoring the protests all week long and caught up with one of the protest organizers, who said they weren't concerned about agitators attempting to disrupt the march. "I'm not worried about that stuff," said Faayani Aboma Mijana, spokesperson for March on DNC. "What I'm worried about is this march that we're having. We're having a march with many thousands of people. We're protesting a genocide that the Democratic party leadership is responsible for and we want to tell them that we're not with it. That's what I'm focused on." Cook County is home to a large Palestinian population, and the crowds were made up of people of all ages, some old enough to have been around in 1968. That's when a Democratic convention here gave the city a black eye over police clashes with Vietnam War demonstrators. RELATED STORY | [More than 40,000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza, the territory‚Äôs Health Ministry says](https://www.scrippsnews.com/world/israel-at-war/more-than-40-000-palestinians-have-been-killed-in-gaza-the-territorys-health-ministry-says) Mirroring that same anti-war movement of more than half a century ago, Mijana told Scripps News that an end to the war in Gaza is the protesters' biggest pressure point on the Democratic delegates attending the DNC this year. "The Democratic party has made its position known with regard to this genocide, but that's why we're out here," Mijana added. "We're out here to force them to do what we want. We're mobilizing people. We're building a movement to pressure them to end U.S. aid to Israel. That's our focus."

author: @kbtxnews
title: DEGALLERY holds its first, First Saturday of the year
text: DEGALLERY holds its first, First Saturday of the year BRYAN, Texas (KBTX) - Artists and art enthusiasts alike gathered at DEGALLERY in Bryan on Saturday to participate in the business‚Äôs First Saturday of the year. First Saturday is a monthly event that allows local artists to market and display their work as well as give people an opportunity to ask questions. DEGALLERY also offers classes for kids along with discounts on art. Owner Dary Dega said they have been putting the event on for four years already. The event is open to any artist of any medium or level. That includes jewelry makers, wood makers, crafters and even kids. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very important for our local artists as an opportunity to advertise ourselves and sell the art,‚Äù Dega said. ‚ÄúA lot of markets around BCS are more farmers markets, not art markets, so we have a lot of people come in specifically to purchase art, see regional art, and talk with artists directly.‚Äù Dega said she was surprised about the good turnout of art lovers, collectors, and sales as they kicked off the new year. ‚ÄúWe have people from Dallas and from another area who visited us,‚Äù Dega said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs wonderful. I‚Äôm happy a lot of vendors have sales and I‚Äôm glad I have a lot of new tourists, and also kids who attend our classes. I am glad we make people happy and it‚Äôs not just entertainment it‚Äôs education.‚Äù DEGALLERY has a lot of plans for 2024 including its big events. Dega said something the business would like to do is to increase the size of its art market and provide more crafting programs for kids and adults along with adding more classes. ‚ÄúMy wish is that more people start to do art,‚Äù Dega said. ‚ÄúI wish a lot of teenagers would think of art not as a hobby, but as a very important thing in their life. Even adults, even retired adults find some good hobbies, and time here. My wish and goal is to increase art in our community here.‚Äù Those interested can learn more about DEGALLERY at this [link. ](https://degallery.us/) Copyright 2024 KBTX. All rights reserved.

author: National Weather Service
title: Winter Storm Warning issued March 22 at 1:25PM PDT until March 24 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
text:
Winter Storm Warning issued March 22 at 1:25PM PDT until March 24 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
* WHAT‚Ä¶Heavy snow expected above 5000 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 6 inches from 5000 to 6000 feet, 6 to 12
inches from 6000 to 7000 feet, and 12 to 18 inches above 7000
feet. A trace to an inch of snow possible from 4500 to 5000
feet. Wind gusts of 65 to 75 mph.
* WHERE‚Ä¶San Bernardino County Mountains and Riverside County
Mountains.
* WHEN‚Ä¶From 8 AM Saturday to 11 PM PDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS‚Ä¶Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very
strong winds could cause extensive tree damage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS‚Ä¶Snow levels around 7000 feet Saturday
morning will fall to around 4500 feet early Sunday morning, then
fluctuate between 4500 to 5000 feet for Sunday afternoon and
evening.
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.
For road condition information in California‚Ä¶enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.

author: Sourtech
title: Tel√©fono para Elon Musk: el cofundador de Xiaomi present√≥ su primer auto el√©ctrico y promete superar a Tesla - Forbes Argentina
text: Lei Jun, cofundador y consejero delegado de Xiaomi, present√≥ el jueves el primer veh√≠culo el√©ctrico de la empresa, lo que supone la entrada del fabricante chino de smartphones en el competitivo mercado de los veh√≠culos el√©ctricos. El multimillonario se abstuvo de revelar la fecha exacta de lanzamiento o el precio del SU7, abreviatura de Speed Ultra, pero s√≠ afirm√≥ que Xiaomi pretende convertirse en uno de los principales actores del sector a escala mundial. La compa√±√≠a hab√≠a dicho anteriormente que planeaba lanzar el coche en la primera mitad de 2024. "Despu√©s de tres a√±os fabricando coches, me di cuenta de lo dif√≠cil que es esta empresa", dijo Lei. "Pero despu√©s de 15 a 20 a√±os de duro trabajo, nuestro objetivo es convertir a Xiaomi en una de las cinco principales empresas de veh√≠culos el√©ctricos del mundo". Como uno de los lanzamientos de producto m√°s esperados del a√±o, Lei se dirigi√≥ a un p√∫blico repleto en el Centro Nacional de Convenciones de China en Pek√≠n, donde describi√≥ algunas de las caracter√≠sticas del nuevo veh√≠culo. Lei no revel√≥ la autonom√≠a de los veh√≠culos el√©ctricos de Xiaomi, pero s√≠ dijo que funcionar√°n con bater√≠as fabricadas en colaboraci√≥n con las empresas chinas BYD y Contemporary Amperex Technologies. Tambi√©n se dice que los veh√≠culos son capaces de mantener su autonom√≠a en condiciones de fr√≠o extremo, cuando normalmente consumen m√°s energ√≠a para calentar el compartimento. Xiaomi afirma que el SU7 superar√° a los veh√≠culos el√©ctricos de gama alta de Tesla o Porsche gracias a los avances de la empresa tecnol√≥gica en el motor del veh√≠culo, la conducci√≥n aut√≥noma y los sistemas de gesti√≥n de la bater√≠a. El lunes, Lei escribi√≥ en la red social china Weibo que el SU7 podr√≠a parecer "un poco caro". El modelo rivalizar√° en prestaciones con el deportivo totalmente el√©ctrico Taycan Turbo de Porsche, que puede recorrer hasta 627 kil√≥metros con una sola carga. Tambi√©n se fabricar√° con funciones de conducci√≥n inteligente similares a las del Model S de Tesla, seg√∫n la publicaci√≥n de Lei en las redes sociales. "Sin duda superaremos las expectativas de la gente", escribi√≥ el ejecutivo de 54 a√±os en Weibo. El veh√≠culo el√©ctrico de Xiaomi ser√° probablemente una berlina de cinco plazas con techo panor√°mico de cristal, seg√∫n un informe publicado en noviembre por el Ministerio de Industria y Tecnolog√≠a de la Informaci√≥n chino. Un post publicado el jueves en la cuenta oficial de la empresa en Weibo tambi√©n muestra un coche azul brillante con techo de cristal oscuro. Hoy ha desvelado otros dos colores, verde y gris. Mientras tanto, se espera que el mercado chino de veh√≠culos de nueva energ√≠a crezca alrededor de un 20% el a√±o que viene, hasta alcanzar los 11 millones de unidades, lo que significa que aproximadamente uno de cada tres coches vendidos en el pa√≠s funcionar√° con electricidad, seg√∫n estimaciones de la Asociaci√≥n China de Turismos. La competencia entre los fabricantes de veh√≠culos el√©ctricos, como Tesla y BYD, de Wang Chuanfu, ya es muy intensa y han recurrido a agresivos recortes de precios para arrebatarse cuota de mercado unos a otros. Lei dice que la competencia no le disuade, al menos en lo que respecta a la conducci√≥n aut√≥noma. "Las tecnolog√≠as de conducci√≥n aut√≥noma cambian muy deprisa, y empezar tarde tiene sus ventajas", afirma. "Significa que podemos trabajar desde un umbral m√°s alto y construir a partir de ah√≠".

author: Antonis Stroggylakis
title: Victor Wembanyama: Partying, alcohol, drugs. Why would I ever do that?
text:
By Eurohoops team / info@eurohoops.net
San Antonio Spurs rookie star Victor Wembanyama explained how he doesn‚Äôt get distracted by what could turn his attention away from basketball.
‚ÄúI just feel like I‚Äôm immune to the things [for which] people try to tell me ‚ÄòOh pay attention to this‚Äô or ‚ÄòWatch out‚Äô. All the bad things. Distractions like partying, alcohol, drugs, whatever,‚Äù Wemby said in an interview for The Ringer.
Like, why would I ever do that? I don‚Äôt have nothing to compensate for,‚Äù Wembanyama added. ‚ÄúBecause I choose to face‚Ä¶ all the things that we have inside of us.‚Äù
Wembanyama, the heavy favorite to win Rookie of the Year, finished his first NBA season with 21.4 points, 10.6 rebounds, 3.9 assists, 3.6 blocks and steals in 29.7 minutes over 71 games. The French big man led the Spurs in points, rebounds, blocks and steals.
Nothing though comes as a surprise. He‚Äôs been working hard for this after all.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs impossible to be surprised by your own performance, good or bad,‚Äù Wembanyama said. ‚ÄúBecause, ultimately, everything is a result of your own work and your mentality. I always want more, so I‚Äôm not surprised.‚Äù
From the first moment he entered the NBA world, Wembanyama got the chance to be mentored by one of the true all-time greats: Gregg Popovich.
‚ÄúI mean, before meeting him, I would‚Äôve thought he was more of an asshole,‚Äù Wembanyama said of five-time NBA champion Popovich with a laugh. ‚ÄúBut he‚Äôs actually very fair.‚Äù

author: @UnioneSarda
title: Fuochi d‚Äôartificio: ¬´Alcuni sono come delle bombe a mano¬ª - L'Unione Sarda.it
text:
Ci sono quelli illegali: chi li utilizza rischia una denuncia penale. Poi ci sono quelli di libera vendita: alcuni possono essere usati solo da chi ha regolare licenza, altri da chiunque. ¬´In ogni caso¬ª, spiega Massimo Imbimbo, dirigente della Squadra volante e degli Artificieri, ¬´bisogna usare la massima attenzione nel maneggiare qualsiasi tipo di artificio. Alcuni possono causare gravissime conseguenze fisiche¬ª. In vista dei festeggiamenti di fine anno la Polizia sar√† in campo per garantire la massima sicurezza su pi√π fronti: ordine pubblico per il concerto alla Fiera e la presenza di molte persone nel centro storico, viabilit√† con le pattuglie della Polizia stradale a presidiare le principali vie d‚Äôaccesso alla citt√†, e prevenzione dei furti nelle abitazioni e degli altri reati.
I pericoli
Massima attenzione anche per quanto accadr√† soprattutto il 31 notte con l‚Äôutilizzo dei fuochi d‚Äôartificio. Per questo gli specialisti degli Artificieri ricordano alcune precauzioni da adottare nell‚Äôutilizzo dei prodotti legali: ¬´Anche in questo caso¬ª, evidenzia l‚Äôispettore Marco Mele, ¬´non bisogna mai tenere in mano un fuoco dopo l‚Äôaccensione della miccia, ma poggiarlo a terra e allontanarsi il pi√π possibile. Non bisogna inoltre accendere micce di collegamento tra vari fuochi. E non lasciarli su terreni con pietre perch√© l‚Äôesplosione pu√≤ proiettare sassi anche a distanza¬ª. I prodotti illegali sono quelli pi√π pericolosi perch√© pi√π potenti e potenzialmente difettosi, non avendo alcuna garanzia. ¬´Possono essere come una bomba a mano. Con conseguenze devastanti sulle persone¬ª. Il dirigente ricorda che l‚Äôuso di artifici illegali √® reato penale. E aggiunge: ¬´Non bisogna mai raccogliere fuochi inesplosi o riaccendere quelli gi√† utilizzati¬ª.
I servizi
In vista di Capodanno sar√† operativo un servizio di prevenzione e controllo con tutte le forze dell‚Äôordine. E saranno al lavoro anche gli agenti della Polizia Stradale: ¬´Non mettetevi alla guida se non siete in condizioni psico fisiche ottimali¬ª, sottolinea Lorenzo Cosseddu della Stradale. ¬´E prestate la massima attenzione nel rispetto delle regole del codice della strada. La causa principale degli incidenti √® quasi sempre la distrazione¬ª.

author: Grateful Calvin
title: That Didn't Go As Planned: MSNBC Fails to Push Racism and Sexism With Black Women Voters
text: The legacy media is doing its best to slap some lipstick on the pig that is the Harris-Walz presidential ticket but at a certain point, maybe it's time to admit that it's not going to work and everyone would be better off just making some pork chops and bacon. We can't be sure, but we think that may have been the case yesterday when MSNBC's Alex Wagner interviewed several black women who aren't falling in line with the narrative that they are obligated to vote for Kamala Harris. For full disclosure, the people in the clip below are admittedly black Republican women. But black women are supposed to be the most reliable voting bloc for Democrats, so why would Wagner give prominent air time to women who don't fit that mold unless it's becoming clear that the Harris ship is sinking? It's possible that Wagner accidentally committed an act of journalism, but we think it's more likely that she thought she could influence these women with Democrat narratives. Whoa, Nellie was that a big mistake. Watch: MSNBC tried their best to bait these Philly voters into celebrating Kamala Harris ‚Äî Kevin Dalton (@TheKevinDalton) The Philly voters weren‚Äôt having it[pic.twitter.com/UfpdYyfqoN][October 23, 2024] Wagner tries to push many of the popular narratives on this group of women, like misogyny and racism, and they are having exactly NONE of that. Most notably, everyone in the video agrees that they don't care about Harris's sex or race. They care that she is unqualified and has demonstrated it through four years of being the vice president. So, THAT didn't go as planned, LOL. This is beyond epic. ‚Äî Schadenfreudelish (@aggierican)[https://t.co/O5WSby2peZ][October 23, 2024] This wasn't the first time that black voters refuted what Democrats tell them they are supposed to believe. [In another interview Wagner did with black men at a Philadelphia barbershop](https://www.msnbc.com/top-stories/latest/black-voters-swing-state-pennsylvania-harris-trump-rcna176872), the men all blasted Barack Obama for scolding them to 'get in line' to vote for the woman. That's the problem with identity politics. People aren't identities. They're individuals. ‚Äî jimtreacher.substack.com (@jtLOL)[https://t.co/PKfq54uA7d][October 23, 2024] Harris will still win a big majority of black voters, men and women. But that reliable voting group is becoming FAR less reliable for Democrats, particularly in this election, and it's almost certainly because they don't like being treated as an identity. Her shrinking majority among black voters is also almost certainly not enough to secure a win. You GOTTA watch this. These people are not fools. The Democrats wish they were, but they are NOT. ‚Äî FunkyPox (@corrcomm)[https://t.co/X0Db1cIs59][October 23, 2024] They are also not owned by a political party, which is something that frustrates Democrats as much as when Abraham Lincoln told them that they couldn't own black people, period. Surprised that they would even air this! ‚Äî zebz (@zebzyo)[October 23, 2024] As we said, this could be MSNBC (or at least Wagner) searching for a remaining life raft off of Harris's Titanic, but we can't be sure of that. L·¥è Ä·¥Ö have mercy because these women have none. ‚Äî Jay (@OneFineJay)[https://t.co/cRpCWVzb5A][October 23, 2024] LOL. No, they didn't pull any punches, did they? It was an absolute beatdown of Harris as a candidate. Brutal ‚Äî Kaya (@sisterinferior)[https://t.co/MHiiecBwD7][October 23, 2024] Philly don't play. Ever. ü§£ ‚Äî March 4th 1789 (@march4th1789)[October 23, 2024] This is the city that booed Santa Claus at a football game, so no. They're not likely to go light on an unqualified candidate for President. But it is noteworthy that this is Philadelphia, which should be a Democrat stronghold. And it probably still is, but the margins matter in a statewide vote. And the huge margins Obama and even Biden enjoyed are dissipating for Harris very fast. Hang it in the Louvre ! POCs are tired of liberal ‚Äî Ziyad Zreik (@z_zreik) White ladies telling us how to feel and think ![October 23, 2024] ‚ÄúFor me to believe you for another 4 years, you‚Äôre crazy‚Ä¶‚Äù True. Story. ‚Äî Mega Maga Mr. Taco! (@itsmralpastor2u)[October 24, 2024] That was one of the best lines in the whole segment. These ladies destroyed Kamala. ‚Äî Gen. Buck Turgidson (@DisgruntledToo)[pic.twitter.com/GmKiGLDioN][October 23, 2024] Ain't it though? Watching the look on the producers face was glorious. ‚Äî Shark Sandwich (@indubbley)[October 23, 2024] We think he means Wagner, not the producer, but it's still accurate. You can see her trying to look thoughtful and reflective with her finger on her chin, but you can see her eyes internally screaming and thinking, 'Oh, sh*t.' LOL. Cue the liberal tears ‚Äî Jeff Hallett (@jeff_hallett)[pic.twitter.com/A4O7gGPzIi][October 23, 2024] Yes, they will need lots of Kleenex after this video. But it's not just tears. It's rage too. We did not share them here because we don't want to give these types of responses too much oxygen, but if you go to the original tweet above and look at some of the replies from Democrats, they are filled with hate, racism, and sexism against these women for voicing their opinions and speaking honestly. Funny how those are the attacks they try to level at Donald Trump and his supporters. But you know the axiomatic saying about the left: 'Every accusation is a confession.' One thing is for sure. Democrats have a growing problem with black voters who aren't buying their lies anymore. Young black men for sure, but this video indicates that black women might be starting to abandon ship as well. And Kamala Harris is not going to bring anyone back, for all of the reasons these women stated.

author: Thais Fonseca
title: Nana Caymmi √© submetida a nova cirurgia ap√≥s 4 meses internada, no Rio
text:
A cantora Nana Caymmi, 83 anos, segue internada, no Rio de Janeiro, sem previs√£o de alta. Ela foi hospitalizada em agosto e agora precisou de uma traqueostomia, um procedimento que visa possibilitar o paciente respirar sem obstru√ß√£o.
‚ÄúA paciente est√° passando por um per√≠odo de interna√ß√£o prolongada por estar fazendo reabilita√ß√£o fisioter√°pica e fonoaudiol√≥gica. Al√©m disso, tamb√©m passa por um processo de desmame da traqueostomia‚Äù, afirmou a assessoria da Casa de Sa√∫de S√£o Jos√©, na zona sul da capital fluminense, onde a artista est√° internada.
+Nana Caymmi tem piora em estado de sa√∫de e √© transferida para CTI
+Nana Caymmi √© internada horas depois de receber alta no Rio
Nana foi internada em diversas ocasi√µes desde o in√≠cio de julho. Em meio a uma das interna√ß√µes, a artista recebeu um implante de marcapasso ap√≥s um quadro de arritmia card√≠aca.
Em agosto, a artista passou por um cateterismo e recebeu alta cinco dias depois. Por√©m, o quadro de sa√∫de piorou e ela retornou √† unidade m√©dica, onde segue sob cuidados m√©dicos desde ent√£o.
Na ocasi√£o, o hospital informou que a interna√ß√£o se deu para ajuste do marcapasso.

author: @BFMParis
title: Orages en Seine-et-Marne: la maire de Sablonni√®res √©voque "des quantit√©s astronomiques d'eau"
text: Le d√©partement de la Seine-et-Marne reste pour l'heure plac√© en vigilance orange pour crue par M√©t√©o-France jusqu'√† minuit dans la nuit du samedi 3 au dimanche 4 ao√ªt. D'importants d√©g√¢ts sont constat√©s, des maisons et des routes ont √©t√© emport√©es."

author: International Rescue Committee
title: Syria: Insights from the Ahlan Simsim scaling journey
text: Ahlan Simsim (‚ÄúWelcome Sesame‚Äù in Arabic) is a transformational early childhood development (ECD) initiative of Sesame Workshop and the International Rescue Committee (IRC) that integrates direct ECD services for children and caregivers with educational media, including the Arabic-language TV show produced by Sesame Workshop, also titled Ahlan Simsim. Since its launch in 2018, Ahlan Simsim has sought to deliberately respond to immediate urgent needs while also thinking towards long-term impact, and to do so at scale. As such, scaling ‚Äì expanding, deepening and sustaining impact ‚Äì is core to our approach. The Insights from the Ahlan Simsim Scaling Journey report draws out insights from the IRC‚Äôs analysis of Ahlan Simsim‚Äôs experience scaling direct service interventions for children and caregivers in partnership with local actors, such as ministries of education, health and social development. The report highlights six interconnected themes: understanding the system, ownership, collaborative partnership, adaptive management, co-design for scale, and investment for scale. Analysis found that success in scaling ECD outcomes critically depends on careful consideration of each of these six themes. In cases where vital components within a theme were not addressed, progress towards scale either stalled or the intervention discontinued. Components of themes are interlinked and in combination, they form the foundation for sustaining scale through strengthening the systems that support children and families. These insights offer a way to think differently about big projects, working towards scale and long-term impact. They can be applied as much to ECD as they can to climate or other critical challenges.
